## [**Collaborators** | **Frank Hase**](../../team.qmd#collab-team)
::::

:::: {#about-heading}
::: {.about-section} 

Frank Hase is the head of the groundbased remote sensing group of IMK-ASF, KIT, and leads the [COCCON](https://www.imk-asf.kit.edu/english/COCCON.php) network, which is based on a new type of portable FTIR spectrometer for the measurement of the main greenhouse gases was developed by the KIT in cooperation with Bruker Optics (Ettlingen, Germany). 

## Education

- [PhD in Physics]{.fw-bold} |  University of Karlsruhe  |  1997 - 2000
- [Diploma in Physics]{.fw-bold} |  University of Karlsruhe |  1995

## Professional Experience

- [2022]{.fw-bold} Habilitation at KIT (Department of Civil Engineering, Geo and Environmental Sciences), 
- [2021-now]{.fw-bold} Head of the groundbased remote sensing group of IMK-ASF, KIT
- [2017-now]{.fw-bold} Head of COCCON project
- [2002-2021]{.fw-bold} Staff scientist in groundbased remote sensing group of IMK-ASF, KIT,
- [2002]{.fw-bold} Visiting Scientist at NCAR 2002
- [2000-2002]{.fw-bold} Postdoc in groundbased remote sensing group of IMK-ASF, KIT
